definition: to harp on/over and over/merely ring changes on a few terms
top (of the head)/apex/to fall forwards/inverted/to jolt
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: The article merely rings the changes on a few terms.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章里颠来倒去就这么几个词。

sentences.english: He kept harping on the same story .
sentences.chinese: 他颠来倒去地重复着同一个故事。

sentences.english: She opened it at the appropriate page and then turned the directory upside-down.
sentences.chinese: 她把它打开到正确的页面然后把目录颠来倒去地翻。

sentences.english: He repeated the same story over and over.; He kept harping on the same story.
sentences.chinese: 他颠来倒去地重复着同一个故事。

definition: to toss and turn (sleeplessly)/again and again
confused/disorderly/incoherent
repeatedly/back and forth again and again
to not know what sb is driving at/to be unintelligible
repeatedly/time and time again
over and over
to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
to mumble in whispers/to mutter to oneself
(onom.) to jabber/to rumble
to chatter/to babble
lit. a donkey's lips do not match a horse's mouth (idiom)/fig. beside the point/incongruous
pinyin: lu:2 chun2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3

definition: to fail to grasp the main points
to search one's guts and belly (idiom); to racks one's brains for a solution
to not fully understand/to only partly understand
amidst the clouds and mist/(fig.) mystified/puzzled
lit. ripe as a melon that rolls from its vine (idiom); fig. to know fluently/to know sth inside out/to know sth by heart
